entries: This weapon, pulsating with psychic energy, is only usable by the most intelligent wielders. Its power grows with the intelligence modyfier of its wielder:

entries.caption: Stacking Effects
rows: This weapon works like a normal weapon, but inteligence can be used for attack rolls made with it.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon

You gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls with this weapon. Additionally, while wielding this weapon, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC while wielding this weapon.
You gain an additional +2 bonus to damage rolls with this weapon and attacks with this weapon deal psychic damage instead.

entries: This sword is home to a swarm of magical wasps. To atune to this weapon you have to use it 10 times to attack another creature

entries.name: Unfriendly at first
entries: Using this Sword while you are not attuned to it will cause the wasps to attack you. When you take the attack action using this sword you take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

entries.name: Small Stings
entries: This weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. This trait only works while the swarm is in the weapon and alive.

entries.name: Friend of the Swarm
entries: While attuned to this sword, you can use your bonus action to command the {@creature Swarm of Wasps||Swarm} to leave or reenter the sword. While outside of the sword the swarm acts right after you and attacks the last creature you attacked. While within the sword, the swarm and the sword do only count as one object.

entries.name: Adaptive Swarm
entries: When the swarm takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to command the swarm to addept. If you do so, the swarm gains resistance to that type of of damage for the next minute. The swarm can only ever have one resistance from this ability at a time. If you command them to adept, while they still have a resistance, the old one is replaced. If the swarm is within the sword while having a resistance from this ability and you are wielding the sword, you also have this resistance.

entries.name: Keeping the Queen
entries: The swarm regains all it's hit points every day at dawn. If the swarm died it also returns at this time.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the sword is on your person, you also gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.

entries.name: Misfortune
entries: If the sword is on your person, you can call on its missfortune (no action required) to make a creature within 60 feet of you reroll one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you dislike. It must use the second roll. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Wish
entries: The sword has 1 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and cast the wish spell from it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. The sword loses this property if it has no charges.
This magical Armor was made out of the Plate Armor of a Spiderdrake.

entries.name: Magical
entries: You have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

entries.name: Acidic Defense
entries: While being attuned to and wearing this armor you are resistant to Acid damage.

entries.name: Armor of Styx
entries: While being attuned to and wearing this armor your Intelligence score increases by 2 up to a maximum of 20.

item.name: Lesser Ring of Shadows
entries: While wearing this ring, the hand you wear it on, is covered in dark red smoke. This smoke reacts to wind and it's odorless.

item.name: Transport Ring of Xyn
entries: While you are attuned to this ring, you can summon a creature home to Xyn to ride on.
It listens to your command but disapears back into the ring at any indication of danger.
The walking speed of the creature is 60ft. Also, the summoned creature counts as a large creature for the purposes of rideability.
There are Transport rings for the following creatures:
{@creature Jagras|MHMM|Jagras}
{@creature Moorbounder|EGW|Moorbounder}
{@creature Axe Beak|MM|Axe Beak}
{@creature Clawfoot|ERLW|Clawfoot}
{@creature Gastodon|MHMM|Gastodon}
{@creature Giant Spider|MM|Giant Spider}
{@creature Giant Toad|MM|Giant Toad}
{@creature Hadrosaurus|VGM|Hadrosaurus}
{@creature Kestodon|MHMM|Kestodon}
{@creature Panther|MM|Panther}
{@creature Pig|SKT|Pig}
{@creature Saber-Toothed Tiger|MM|Saber-Toothed Tiger}
{@creature Tiger|MM|Tiger}
{@creature War Ostrich|ToB|War Ostrich}
{@creature Zebra|ToA|Zebra}

item.name: Staff of Count Darrien von Steen
entries: This staff is a rod, approximately two and a half feet long, decorated in black and gold and crowned with cap in the shape of a hawk's head. It pulses with necrotic energie. While attuned to it you can spend an action to summon up to 2 {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|Vampiric Mists} that follow your command. They act right after your turn.
Once you used this abbility, you can't use it again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Special Attunement
entries: To attune to this Staff, you have to hold it in your hand and exclaim 'I do the Devils work'.

entries.name: Vampires Curse
entries: When you attune to this item, your alignment changes to evil.
While holding the staff, glowing red veins curse through your hand.

item.name: Overgrowth, Bond of Symbiosis
entries: Once attuned to the proper druid this plain ring sprouts. The radius of your Halo of Spores increases by 10ft. You gain an additional reaction each round which can only be used on Halo of Spores.
Fungal Infestation increases by 10ft. All zombies animated by Fungal Infestation are surrounded by your Halo of Spores.
Once per day, your spores can replicate the effect of {@spell greater restoration}, allowing you to cast it as a reaction and without expending a spell slot on any creature within a Halo of Spores.

entries.name: A Siren's Wisdom
entries: This Cape is filled with magic of the Ocean. Five Spells are stored within its fabric, a cantrip and one spell each from 1st to 4th level. You can use an action to speak the cape's command word to cast one of the following spells only requiring verbal or somatic components, charisma is your spellcasting abbility  for these spells. Each spell can only be cast once per day, regaining expended spells each day at dusk.

entries.name: Arcane Fabric
entries: This cape's fabric has the following spells stored in it:

entries.name: Moving Grace
entries: If you don't have a swimming speed, while wearing this cape, you have a swimming speed of 30ft.
Or, if you have a swimming speed, while wearing this cape, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

item.name: Qvo's Spell Disk
entries: While holding this disk, you can cast spells up to the number of arms you have, in one turn.

If any creature other than Friedisch Adum Qvo uses this Artefact, this artefact is destroyed in an explosion. If that happens any creature within 15ft. of the disk, has to make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 16d6} fire damage, taking half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Spy's Diplomat's Pouch
entries: This Pouch has the name of someone embroided on the bottom. Any letter adressed to the embroided name and send via a {@item Diplomat's Pouch|SaF|Diplomat's Pouch} is also send to this pouch, as if it also belonged to the recipient.

item.name: Diplomat's Compass
entries: This Compass has a small hidden compartment in the bottom. If a note with a name on it is put in this compartment, this compass points into the direction of the nerest {@item Diplomat's Pouch|SaF|Diplomat's Pouch} belonging to someone with that name.

item.name: Ring of Driglon, the spree demon
entries: While wearing this ring, you can speak its command word as an action to summon a particular {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon} from within the Gem. The {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon} appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 120 feet of you. It remains as long as you concentrate (as if concentrating on a spell), to a maximum of 1 hour, or until it drops to 0 hit points. It then returns to the gem.

Roll initiative for {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon}, which has its own turns. When you summon it and on each of your turns thereafter, you can issue a verbal command to it (requiring no action on your part), telling it what it must do on its next turn. If you issue no command, it spends its turn attacking any creature within reach that has attacked it.

At the end of each of the demon's turns, it makes a Charisma saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, the {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon} continues to obey you. On a successful save, your control of {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon} ends for the rest of the duration, and the demon spends its turns pursuing and attacking the nearest non-demons to the best of its ability. If you stop concentrating on the spell before it reaches its full duration, an uncontrolled {@creature Driglon, the spree demon|BMHS|Driglon, the spree demon} doesn't disappear for {@dice 1d6} rounds if it still has hit points.

item.name: Shard of the Clod
entries: A part of the crystal that created the clod.

While attuned to this crystaline shard, you can use your action to spend 1 hit die and summon a {@creature Clod Fighter|BMHS|Clod Fighter} made out of nerby materials. This {@creature Clod Fighter|BMHS|Clod Fighter} listens to you. You can use a bonus action to command him.
This ability can only be used once per day.
You can only summon one {@creature Clod Fighter|BMHS|Clod Fighter} at a time.

item.name: Zevellon’s Steps
entries: While you wear these boots, every step you take reverberates with power and grace, and your movement speed increases by 10 feet. The boots subtly increase your height, giving you a more powerful presence. A radiant glow emanates from the bottom of these silver boots.

In addition, you can use an action or a bonus action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If you use this property as a bonus action, you must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, you take {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage but still teleport to your chosen space.
Once attuned to these boots, you gain the following flaw: 'I must seek out the other pieces of this armor at all cost.'
While wearing these boots you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.
All parts of Zevillons armor count as a single item for the purposes of your magic item attunement limit.
Once you attune to any piece of the armor, it can’t be removed and you can’t unattune from it unless you die or the wish spell is cast to remove it.

item.name: True Zevellon’s Steps
entries: While you wear these boots, every step you take reverberates with power and grace, and your movement speed increases by 10 feet. The boots subtly increase your height, giving you a more powerful presence. The boots resemble the clawed feet of an Abyssal creature.

In addition, you can use an action or a bonus action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If you use this property as a bonus action, you must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, you take {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage but still teleport to your chosen space.
Once attuned to these boots, you gain the following flaw: 'I must seek out the other pieces of this armor at all cost.'
While wearing these boots you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.
All parts of Zevillons armor count as a single item for the purposes of your magic item attunement limit.
Once you attune to any piece of the armor, it can’t be removed and you can’t unattune from it unless you die or the wish spell is cast to remove it.

item.name: Silksail
entries: These enchanted wraps are made of magically woven spider silk, sheer and light but durable. While wearing these wraps, you can unspool them to make special unarmed strikes with a reach of 15 feet.

These unarmed strikes do no damage, but if you hit a creature no more than one size larger than you, you can attempt to grapple and pull it up to 10 feet toward you using your Dexterity (Acrobatics) check contested by the target’s Strength (Athletics) check. Once on each of your turns, you can instead use the wraps to replicate the effects of a successful attack with a {@item net||net}.

As an action, you can fire the wrappings up to 30 feet away, anchoring them against a solid mass (such as walls or trees), a heavy object, or surfaces (such as walls, floors and ceilings). As part of the same action, you can retract the wrappings, pulling you in to the closest unoccupied space that is adjacent to your anchor, or use the wrapping to swing yourself to another point within 30 feet of the anchor if it is attached to a ceiling. Alternatively, you can detach and anchor the other end instead, allowing creatures to climb across the length of wrapping at full movement speed.
The material is strong enough to support up to 500 pounds, has an AC of 17, and has 25 hit points.

item.name: Javelin of Rotation
entries: This magical javelin was made to slowly widdle down any target.

entries.name: Charges
entries: This javelin has 2 Charges. It regains them at dawn.

entries.name: Piercer
entries: Whenever you hit someone with this javelin, you can spend one charge. If you do so, the javelin magicaly sticks to the creature.

entries.name: Drill
entries: As a bonus action , while the javelin is within 120 ft. of you, you can speak the javelins command word to make it spin. A creature the javelin sticks to takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Returning
entries: Whenever this javelin is within 120ft. of you, you can use a bonus action to recall it to your hand.

item.name: Hammer of the Hydra
entries: This magical Warhammer was made out of a skull of a Hydra. Legend Says the Hydra still lives on somewhere.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Teeth Out
entries: Whenever you attack with this weapon you may choose to deal piercing damage instead. If you do that the damage die of this weapon changes to {@damage 2d4}.

entries.name: Head after Head
entries: If you successfully hit the creature with this hammer, that you successfully hit with your last attack with this hammer, you deal {@damage 1d4} damage in addition to the damage of your last Attack. The maximum nuber of Additional d4s you can deal with this ability equals to your Strength modifier. If you let go of your Hammer or Attack without using it, your damage returns to normal.

item.name: Truth
entries: This magical Warhammer was made to inflict great amounts of damage, to extract the truth from your enemys.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Extracting the Truth
entries: A creature that is hit with this hammer can't speak a deliberate lie for 1 round.

An affected creature is aware of this and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such creatures can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

item.name: Flaming Hammer
entries: This magical Warhammer is warm to the touch.

entries.name: Magic Weapon
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

entries.name: Flame Strike
entries: You can make a melee weapon attack with a reach of 100 ft. once per dawn. If that attack hits, it deals an additional {@damage 8d6} fire damage.

item.name: Arcane Pendant
entries: A powerful magical entity is entrapped in the pendant of this necklace. This enables the wearer to use some of the creatures magic.

entries.name: Magical Enhancement
entries: While you are holding this wand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

entries.name: Supress Magic
entries: This Pendant has 3 charges and recharges {@dice 1d4-1} every day at dawn.

You can use 1 charge and target one magic item you can see within 120 feet of you. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, until the arcane pendant is on a different plane than the item or your attunement to it stops, or until you use a bonus action to end the effect.

entries.name: Transfigurate
entries: While attuned to this pendant, you can look through the gem hanging from it, and if you do, you understand every writing you see through it.

entries.name: Artifact
entries: This magic item may have more properties that arent been revealed yet.

item.name: Arrows of the Planes
entries: These Arrows seem to be imbued with various spells. They can be shot with any bow. When these arrows are shot, they deal damage and always activate their effect. After any of the the arrows' magic is triggert one roll a d4, on a 1 or 2 the arrow breaks and looses it's magic. The arrows present are:

entries.name: Burn
entries: An arrow made from burnt wood with a small ruby tip. This Arrow explodes on impact. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on it's position must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature is hit with this arrow it makes it's saving throw with disadvantage. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

entries.name: Excavate
entries: An arrow somehow entirely made from stone. Whenever this arrow impacts a surface it removes all non-magical stone and rock within a 5 ft radius around it.

entries.name: Freeze
entries: An arrow made from drift wood with a small aquamarine as a tip. On the last 30 feet (or less if the arrow traveled less) feet of the arrows hooting path a 10 ft. wide line of the ground is coated in a thick layer of ice for the next minute. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 4d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature is hit with this arrow it makes it's saving throw with disadvantage.The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration and any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 2d6 cold damage.

entries.name: Translate
entries: An arrow made from birch with a small shard of Obsidian as a tip. Wherever this arrow lands, you are teleportet to the nearest place of it, that isn't occupied.

item.name: Mirror Shield
entries: This white shield is capable of defending against magic. It has one charge which it regains at dawn.

When you are the target of a spell of 6th level or lower, that only targets you, you can spend your reaction and the charge of this shield to either make the spell targeting you fail or to redirect it onto a different target that was in range of the initial spell, when it was cast.
If this shield is used to redirect a {@spell Disintegrate} spell, it shatters after redirecting or making it fail.

item.name: Gauntlet of Tyla'zhus
entries: A Gauntlet that only has room for 4 fingers. Its has a ruby on the back. While wearing this gauntlet you can, once per long rest, use one of its abillities. Use Intelligence as your spellcasting ability for this Gauntlet.

entries.name: Burn
entries: Out of the Ruby on the back of the Gauntlet shoots a flaming beam as by the scorching ray spell.

entries.name: Tell
entries: The Gauntlet inflicts unbearable pain on the mind of one creature within 5 feet of it, that is restrained. The Creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie for the next 5 minutes. The wearer of the Gauntlet knows whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

item.name: Skin of Ifil
entries: One of the 10 legendary artifacts made from the remains of Ifil. The skin of Ifil is said to give the wearer the impenetrable defense of the beast. It gives these properties:

entries.name: Masters of Magic
entries: Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to become immune to all effects and damage of any magic item except ones made from Ifil until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Ultimate Defense
entries: While wearing this glove your AC increases by 2, additionally Once per short rest you can use the glove to cast the shield spell.

entries.name: Curse of Ifil
entries: Anyone putting on the glove automatically attunes to it. When this happens, the glove of ifil fuses with the persons hand and becomes part of their body. The only way to remove The Skin of Ifil is to cut of the hand.

entries.name: Growth of Ifil
entries: While the Skin of Ifil is attuned to a creature the black skin slowly creeps over the attuned creatures body until, after a time of 1d4 month, the creature is fully engulfed by the skin and its alignment changes to evil and its creature type becomes undead.

entries.name: Artifact
entries: The Skin of Ifil may have more properties that arenbt discovered yet.

item.name: Finger of Ifil
entries: One of the 10 legendary artifacts made from the remains of Ifil. The finger of Ifil is said to give the wearer the mystical atributes of the beast. It gives these properties:

entries.name: Masters of Magic
entries: Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to become immune to all effects and damage of any magic item except ones made from Ifil until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Thieve of Power
entries: Once a week, while you are holding the finger of ifil and are attuned to it, you can point it at a creature and choose an abbility score. You and that creature trade those abbility scores with each other.

entries.name: Curse of Ifil
entries: Trying to use the finger of ifil will atune you to it, once attuned you can't unatune from it.

entries.name: Artifact
entries: The Skin of Ifil may have more properties that arenbt discovered yet.

item.name: Liquid Bravery
entries: This Potion looks a bit like brackish swamp-water, and tastes basically the same as it looks. When you drink this potion, you have advantage on all saving throws against being frightened when fighting an enemy that is at least one size bigger than you, and your first melee attack each turn against that target is made with advantage. When the effect ends, you gain one level of exhaustion. This effects ends after 10 minutes or until you fall unconscious.

item.name: Jar of Fetch Stickers
entries: This jar contains 5 ({@dice 2d4}) wax stickers in the form of bones. When you stick a sticker on an object weighing up to 10 pounds, in the next two hours, while you are within 200 ft. of the object and the sticker is still attached, you can use an action to call the object into your hand. When you do this, the sticker itself disapears.

item.name: Dimstone
entries: If this stone is in Bright light that isn't sunlight, 5 feet around it is considered to be only dim light.

item.name: Voltearring
entries: This pair of black earrings emits small illusory bursts of lightning.

item.name: Joker Dice
entries: This pair of dice goes up in illusory fire, whenever two 1s are rolled with it.

item.name: Mummy Tadpole
entries: This Tadpole is Mummified and starts to move on it's own, when undead creatures are within 30 feet of it.

item.name: Book of Languages
entries: While within 60 ft. of the book any creature, that can speak a language, understands every language it hears as its own.

item.name: Bayleaf Backpack
entries: Only an attuned creature is able to open this backpack.

item.name: Zephyr Clip
entries: The creature that is wearing this hair clip, has its hair flowing as if in a light breeze.

item.name: Ring of the Squid
entries: While wearing this Ring, the finger on which it is worn can be used as an ink pen with infinite ink.

item.name: Vile Vial
entries: When a full meal is placed in this vile and you speak it's command word the meal turns into a Mould Ball.
The Mould Ball diapears if not consumed within 8 hours.

You can ingest the Mould Ball as an action to release a cloud of foul air infront of you. Every creature within a 30ft. line infront of you has to succeed on a {@dc 14} CON save or take {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage or half as much on a successful one.
If a creature that is not attuned to this vial ingests a mould ball it takes the {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage itself.

item.name: Ring of Amunition
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-2} charges at dawn.

As you reload your weapon, you can spend one charge to create ammunition to load it made of magical energy that can always be used with your weapon. This ammunition is considered a magical weapon and has a +1 to both attack and damage rolls, and you can dismiss it at any time without firing it, though the charge to create it is still lost. The ammunition created will disappear if it falls from your hand, or if any other creature attempts to use it while you are still attuned to the ring. This ammunition disappears after being fired and cannot be retrieved, and the ring cannot create ammunition as long as the last amunition created still exists.

item.name: Monster Manual of Xyn
entries: This Book contains knowledge of many creatures that live in Xyn. When encountering a Creature that you did not check with this book before you can use a bonus action make an investigation check to read this book. You can learn many atributes of these creatures including Name, Weaknesses, Strengh, Resistances, Habitats, Attack Patterns, etc. How much you learn about the creature is dependant on the rarity of the creature.

item.name: Mantle of Holding
entries: The inner pocket of this mantle hase an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The mantle can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The mantle weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the mantle requires an action.

If the mantle is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the mantles inner pocket is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the mantle must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the mantle can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a mantle of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a {@item Heward's handy haversack}, {@item portable hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

item.name: Blood Pearl
entries: This Pearl always contains one drop of blood of the person who directly touched it last.

item.name: Creepy Laughing Doll
entries: This creepy doll of a little girl always stares at the person closest to her. The doll can see anything as if it had truesight. If the person the doll stares at stares back, the doll starts to laugh creepiely.

item.name: Origami Bird
entries: You can write a 100 word message and the name of a person on this piece of paper. Once you write the name of a person, the paper automaticaly folds itself into an origami bird and flies to the person whos name you've written on it.

item.name: Floating Disk
entries: This big silver disk is felted with a blue felt on one side. A medium or smaller creatur can stand on the disk. The attuned creature can concentrate on the disk to make it float. While concentrating on the disk, the attuned creature can use a bonus action to move the disk up to 20 feet.
If a creature, that is standing on a disk is attacked, it has to make a DC 15 Acrobatics(Dexterity) Check or fall of the disk.

item.name: Barrier Blade
item.reqAttune: by a creature with a strengthscore of atleast 18
entries: While you are wielding this blade and are within a damage dealing or status condition inducing AOE Effect, that doesn't deal psychic damage, you can choose to protect the people behind you. If you do you create a protective line that is 15 foot long and 5 ft wide on the opposit side of you from the point of origin of the AOE. Every creature in that line and in the AOE gets Advantage on its saving throws from that aoe and a person in that field within 5 ft. of you instantly succeds all saving throws for that AOE. But if you use this abbility, you automatically fail all your saving throws concerning that AOE.

item.name: Jitter Ichor
entries: After drinking this foul, black potion, your appearance changes to become slightly more cat-like, with blue-black fur. You become cloaked by an illusion that makes you appear to be standing near your actual location, causing attack rolls against you to have disadvantage. If you are hit by an attack, the effect ends.

item.name: Draconic Dreams
entries: When you drink this hot potion, you imediately fall asleap for 1d8 rounds. After weaking back up you can breathe fire until you take a long rest or use this ability once. The Fire breath is a 5 by 20 ft. line. Everyone in the Area has to make a DC 14 Dexterity Saving Throw or take 8d6 Fire Damage or half on a successful save.

item.name: Dream in a Bottle
entries: This light blue potion with foaming bubbles inside tastes purely sweet. You sleep for 30 minutes and cannot be awoken by any means. This refreshes you as if you had a long rest.

item.name: Winning Brawl
entries: This thick potion looks like a galaxy and tastes of blueberry. When you drink it, for the next 30 minutes your punches and kicks count as +1 magic weapons.

item.name: Rage
entries: This spicy potion is a deep red color. After drinking it you gain the barbarian rage:
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
This Rage Lasts for 1 minute and the bonus damage stacks with normal barbarian rage.

item.name: Gug
entries: Gug is what goblins drink. It is mostly made from the cast-offs, leftovers, and mysterious liquids that they scavenge during their raids. Each goblin clan camp has a single large black iron pot that is always kept at a low simmer over embers. This is the Gug Pot. Anything that they decide is worth drinking is thrown into the Gug Pot and mixed up with whatever is already inside by the clan’s shaman. More than a few helpless goblins have found themselves in the Gug Pot as a result of lovers’ quarrels and juvenile pranks gone wrong.

When it’s time to eat, Gug is ladled out of the pot into shallow wooden bowls to be served with the meal. No two pots of Gug ever smell or taste exactly the same, but stale beer, vinegar, and spoiled milk are common flavor combinations. Upon drinking it, make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the player is immediately sick. On a success, they experience some of the goblins’ infamous “fury of the small.” Until their next short or long rest, the player has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, when they make a melee attack using Strength, they gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. If they are knocked unconscious, the effects end.

item.name: Beastfinder
entries: When drinking this carrot juice like potion a carrot appears in the middle of yor face, replacing the nose, if you have one. All herbivore beasts within 30 feet of you will attack you if possible. This lasts for 2 minutes.

item.name: Crates of Home
entries: These two chests are magicaly linked. Every object that is put in the chest that has blue fleece in the lid, appear in the one with the red felt.
Living creatures or plants can't go through the crates but rather stay in the blue chest.
The opening of the chests is 3 feet by 6 feet and only objects that can be put into that opening can be send.
If the red chest is full, the magic of theese items do not work.

disease.name: Gambling Addiction
entries: A creature who is afflicted with a Gambling Addiction must make a {@dc 12} wisdom saving throw or is compelled to gamble when presented with the opportunity.

disease.name: Hydrophobia
entries: A creature who is afflicted with Hydrophobia is afraid of any body of water larger than a small puddle. and has disadvantage on ability checks when in or on water.

disease.name: Tapeworm
entries: A creature who has contracted a Tapeworm must eat twice as much as normal each day or become exhausted.

disease.name: The Common Cold
entries: Just a cold. The aflicted creature will cough and sneeze, but that’s about it..

disease.name: The Wariness
entries: All insight checks the afflicted Creature makes result in they believing that others are lying to or trying to harm them.

disease.name: Tetanus
entries: A Creature with Tetanus has disadvantage on all Skill Checks, Attack Rolls, and Saving throws that use Dexterity.

disease.name: Soft Bones
entries: A Creature with Soft Bones has their AC reduced by 2.

disease.name: Polychromia
entries: A Creature inflicted with Polychromia has each of their eyes views altered as if a random collored sheet of glas where placed before each one. The colors changes every Long Rest the creature takes

disease.name: Capilincrum
entries: All Hair on an inflicted Creatures body grows by 1 inch a day.

disease.name: Ligma
entries: What's Ligma?

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) necrotic damage and the target must make a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is hurled 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target then comes into contact with a hard surface or heavy object, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage per 10 feet moved.

“They were bourne of pure negative energy, like vicious, trembling lions with shredded wings and tails covered in ghostly spikes. In life, they were horrible enough, but now they were something much worse.”

Manticore specters are manticores that were killed by a powerful undead force, trapping them between the Prime Material and afterlife. They are hateful creatures, only interested in the death and destruction of all living things.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dul is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). Dul has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Dul has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: Dul has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multispell
entries: Dul casts up to 4 of it's prepared spells.

action.name: Chilling Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the shadowghast must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to this Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadowghast can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Multi Armed
entries: The Shadowghast has 6 arms. When it takes more than 10 damage in a single turn it loses an arm.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadowghast makes one Claw attack for every arm it has.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Ealigator can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Lunge
entries: When Ealiglass gator leaps at least 10 feet toward a creature and hits that creature with a claws attack on the same turn, it can immediately constrict the target as a bonus action.

trait.name: Transparency
entries: The Ealigator has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while underwater or in dim light.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The Ealigator can long jump up to 15 feet from water or up to 10 feet on land, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Lightning Aura
entries: Lightning sparks off of the ealigator into the surrounding area. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the ealigator takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the Ealigator can't attack a different target.

action.name: Constrict
entries: One creature that's already {@condition grappled} by the glass gator takes 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or half as much poison damage with a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw.

action.name: Lightning Constrict {@recharge 4}
entries: The Ealigator creates a lash of lightning energy that strikes at one creature of it's choice that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward the ealigator and then the target takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage if it is within 5 feet of the ealigator.

reaction.name: Silt Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: After taking damage while in water, the Ealigator thrashes to stir up a 10-foot-radius cloud of silt around itself. The area inside the sphere is heavily obscured for 1 minute (10 rounds) in still water or 5 ({@dice 2d4}) rounds in a strong current. After stirring up the silt, the Ealigator can move its speed.

monster.name: Madtrip

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the Madtrick can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Compounded Sickness
entries: The Madtrick's cocktail of diseases are potent to even the most resolute fighters. Creatures that are normally immune to disease or poison are instead only resistant to a Madtrick's spore ray.

trait.name: Aura of Decay
entries: The Madtrick emits a 90ft radius of noxious vapor centered on itself. At the start of each of the Madtrick's turns, creatures caught in the aura automatically take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Ensnare
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, and the Madtrip attaches to the target. If the target is medium or smaller the Madtrip will gain advantage on the attack roll. If the attack is successful, it engulfs the target's head causing the target to be grappled, blinded and suffocated while engulfed.

While attached to the target, the Madtrip can Ensnare no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The Madtrip's moves with the target and at half speed while attached this way. The Madtrip can carry and fly with a target up to 500 lbs.
A creature can detach the Madtrip by making a successful DC 17 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the Madtrip can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Spore Rays
entries: The Madtrip shoots three of the following magical spore rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Blinding Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or suffer the effects of Blinding Sickness. Pain grips the creature’s mind, and its eyes turn milky white. The creature has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws and is blinded.

items.name: 2. Fever Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects of Filth Fever. A raging fever sweeps through the creature’s body. The creature has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Rot Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects of Flesh Rot disease for 7 days. The creature’s flesh decays. The victim has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to all damage.The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4. Mindfire Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target’s suffers the effects of the Mindfire disease for 7 days. The creature’s mind becomes feverish. The creature has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws, and the creature behaves as if under the effects of the {@spell Confusion} spell during combat.

items.name: 5. Skin-Quake Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is overcome with shaking and suffers from seizures for 7 days. The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity.

items.name: 6. Doom Ray.
items.entry: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or suffer the effects of the Slimy Doom Disease for 7 days. The creature begins to bleed uncontrollably. The creature has disadvantage on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is stunned until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 7. Sleep Ray.
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

items.name: 8. Hallucination Ray.
entries: The targeted creature must make a DC 17 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target loses the ability to distinguish friend from foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies until the spell ends. Each time the target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Whenever the affected creature chooses another creature as a target, it must choose the target at random from among the creatures it can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it’s using. If an enemy provokes an opportunity attack from the affected creature, the creature must make that attack if it is able to.

items.name: 9. Spawning Ray.
items.entry: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage as 3 {@creature Gas Spore||Gas Spores} erupt from the target's chest. They plant themselves in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the target. The {@creature Gas Spore||Gas Spores} act right after the Madtrip on the same initiative count and fight until they’re destroyed.

items.name: 10. Feeblemind Ray.
entries: The target takes 4d6 psychic damage and must make an DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature’s Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can’t cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.
At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.

legendaryHeader: The beholder can take 3 legendary actions, using the Eye Ray option below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The beholder regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Spore Ray
entries: The Madtrip uses one random spore ray.

There are reasons you never give shrooms to a beholder. The feverish dreams that transpire may result in the putrid scourge known as the Madtrip. The embodiment of pestilence and rot, this floating fungi slinks into forests and rots all life around its pustulant form. The air of a Madtrip’s lair grows thick and caustic, blotting out the sun and ensuring Underdark flora and fauna have a place to thrive even on the surface.

Those that survive long enough to behold these vitriolic aberrations, soon succumb to the many deadly gases hissing from its spindly stalks. These otherworldly toxins can cause nightmarish hallucinations, vile curses, or even cause adventurers to vomit more fungal enemies to fight. Some Madtrips enjoy slowly suffocating their victims using their long tube-like stem and parading them around against their will like a false body. For the Madtrip’s only love is decay which it inflicts with voracious delight.

trait.name: Targeted Creature
entries: Once summoned, the Susurrus is imbues with the name of a Target.

trait.name: Barbed Defense
entries: Whenever a creature hits the susurrus with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, that creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Detect Target
entries: The susurrus is aware of the pressence and location of it's target within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Dronesong
entries: As a bonus action, the susurrus can begin a droning song that mesmerizes it's target. When it begins the song, and at the start of each of its turns, it's target that can hear the susurrus’ dronesong that is within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the effect ends for it. The susurrus can end its song at any time.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The susurrus's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The susurrus makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

These peculiar creatures roam the subterranean realms, they are summoned by great minds to hunt their targets.  It’s droning song lulls them into a stupor, making them easy prey for the creature. Susurrus are also known to attack anyone bearing a torch, or creating any kind of open flame, as it saps the precious air they need to survive. They draw in air through holes in their honey-combed exoskeleton, producing a strange breathing noises that is amplified by their dronesong, which can be heard up to a quarter-mile away. A susurrus stands around 7 feet tall and weighs about 500 pounds.

monster.name: Count Darrien von Steen (Vampire)
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 1d4} swarms of {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|Vampiric Mists}, provided that the sun isn't up and there aren't more than two summon mists at the moment. The called creatures arrive immediately, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The creatures remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action. The summoned creatures have 5 hp instead of their normal hp.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: The vampire makes one unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Siren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Siren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
