entries: You shoot a ray of necromantic energy from your outstretched hand, causing one creature of your choice within range to violently purge blood vessels through its skin. Constructs and undead are not affected by this spell. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

On a failed save, the target's purged blood vessels are magically animated, creating a many-layered mass of magically strong, adhesive tissue that trap those caught in them. The avascular mass instantaneously erupts in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the target. The avascular mass is difficult terrain and lightly obscures their area.

If the avascular mass isn't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, it collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn.

Each creature that starts its turn in the avascular mass or that enters them during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. The original target of the spell automatically fails this saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition restrained} as long as it remains in the avascular mass or until it breaks free.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the avascular mass can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.
Any 5-foot cube of avascular mass that takes more than 10 radiant damage on a single turn disintegrates. When the spell ends, the blood vessel mass becomes a small layer of limp, decaying tissue.

spell.name: Lashana's Clutch of Orcus
entries: One humanoid of your choice that you can see within range begins to suffer a magic-induced heart attack. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d8 necrotic damage and be stunned for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes 3d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on the target on a successful one.

spell.name: Moon Blade

components.m: a melee weapon containing silver worth at least 1 sp

entries: You imbue one of your silvered melee weapons with the power of the moon. While imbued in this way the weapon has a reach of 10ft. and deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.
Also, while the weapon is enchanted in this way you can use your bonus action to call it back into your hand.

When you use the weapon to attack a shapechanger, you have advantage on the attack roll. If you hit a shapechanger with your moon blade, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or instantly revert to its original form. An affected shapechanger can't assume a different form until it the end of their next turn.
When you use the weapon to attack an undead creature, you gain a bonus to your attack and damage rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum: 1).
If you end your turn, while not holding the weapon, this spell ends.

spell.name: Bupp's Beast Bombing

components.m: the cured body of a tiny beast

entries: You prime up to 5 tiny beasts within range with necrotic energy and a death wish. The creatures gain the following two abbilities:
{@i Death Leap}. As a reaction the creature can turn an attack that missed it into a hit.

{@i Necrotic Body}. When the creature is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes with necrotic energy in a 5-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (against your spellsave DC), taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
You can't control the creatures, but they will act in a way to hit the most possible people with their Necrotic Body Abbility, but will never intentionally hit you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th Level or higher, you can prime 1 more tiny beast for every level above 3rd.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Psyternative
entries: If you use ink worth atleast 1 gp, wich the spell consumes, as additional material, the damage of this spell changes to psychic, additionally you can prime the beast with up to 10 words. Anyone failing their save hears these words in their head.

spell.name: Equivalent Retrieve
entries: You can switch the position of two items, that are non magical. You have to hold one of the items and it has to be worth more or equal to the other item; and you have to have touched the other item before. If one ore both of the items are held or worn by another person, the person can choose to make a strength saving throw. On a successful save this spell does nothing.

spell.name: Be Me

components.m: two silver rings worth 100GP each, which the spell consumes

entries: You and a willing creature, that you touch switch conciousness. The switched creatures just take their memory and character with them. A swaped creature can do anything the body and mind could before the switch. After 1 hour, the switched people have to be within 120 feet of each other, or the switch is permanent. (can be reversed by casting it again and failing this requirement again.)

spell.name: Punish Magic

components.m: a mithril needle worth atleast 250 gp

entries: Choose any creature, object, or magical Effect within range. One spell of your choice of 3rd Level or lower on the target ends. For a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your Spellcasting Ability. The DC equals 12 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends. If the spell ends, the creature who cast the spell takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th Level or higher, you automatically end the Effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used minus two.

When you choose this monastic tradition at 3rd level, you become proficient in the Athletics and Performance skills if you do not already have them. The nature of your Unarmored Defense changes. While wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. Your Ki save DC also changes:

subclassFeature.name: Keeping the fight alive
entries: Your mystical touch can heal wounds so that no battle shall be boring. Starting at 3rd level, you have a pool of magical healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your monk level × your monk die. As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature. This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

subclassFeature.name: Strong Fingers
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can shove or grapple a creature instead of making an unarmed strike with attacks made as a part of your Flurry of Blows.

subclassFeature.name: Signature Move
entries: Beginning at 6th level, on your turn when you make an unarmed strike, you can declare you are performing your signature move. If you hit, the attack deals additional damage equal to two of your Martial Arts Dice. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier and they replenish after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sleeper Hold
entries: At 11th level, you can put a creature you are grappling into a sleeper hold. As an action, you expend 2 to 6 ki points. Roll 5d8, plus an additional 1d8 for each ki point in excess of 2 you spend. If the creature has fewer hit points than the total of your roll, it falls unconscious for 1 minute. Constructs, undead and other creatures that do not need to breathe or are immune to being charmed aren’t affected by your sleeper hold.

subclassFeature.name: Twirling Grapple
entries: Also at 11th level, if you are attacked while you are grappling a creature equal to your size or larger, you can spend 3 ki points to use your reaction to position the creature advantageously to you. You gain the benefits of three-quarters cover (+5 AC). If the attack misses you, but the attack roll is higher than the Armor Class of the creature you are grappling, that creature becomes the target of the incoming attack instead.

subclassFeature.name: Mucho Macho Combo
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to make a devastating flying suplex against a creature you are grappling. When you finish a Flurry of Blows and are grappling a creature, you can spend 1-9 additional ki points to making a flying suplex with one creature you are grappling. Upon impact, the creature you are grappling takes 2d10 force damage per ki point spent.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength, Dexterity and, Constitution scores increase by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Drosera reach adulthood at around 15 years and live up to 150 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most drosera are evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Drosera average about 6 feet tall and weigh about 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a movement speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Headplate Vision
entries: While your headplates are unhinged, you can see in darkness within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light. However, you can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. While your headplates are closed, they obscure your vision considerably: you require bright light to see further than 15 feet away from you, and are only able to see to a distance of 60 feet even with the aid of it. You can hinge or unhinge the headplates that form your jaw using your bonus action. When your jaw is unhinged, your sensitive eyes and mouth are exposed. If you are subject to a critical hit while your jaw is unhinged, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} damage.

entries.name: Carnivorous Bite
entries: While your headplates are unhinged, you can use your fearsome jaw to make melee attacks that deal {@damage 1d6} piercing damage plus additional acid damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Ambush Hunter
entries: You are proficient with longbows, spears, and the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Mutable
entries: When you reach 3rd level, You can caste the {@spell Snare|XGE|} spell once without any material components. You must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Alter Self} spell once, and must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and plant.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

At first glance, a drosera’s head looks like a large, ripe melon. In truth, is made of two (or in a few tribes, three or even four) thick, interlocked toothed plates which, when opened, expose their mouth and a pair of eyes. This under-visage can be disturbing to other races, and so most traveling Drosera keep their plates closed, wearing fanciful wooden or ceramic masks in a vague mockery of most races’ facial structure. They have a set of air-holes on their necks that allow them to speak and breathe while their headplates are closed. Drosera prefer to eat meat to the exclusion of anything else, and they train their saplings in the art of the ambush from a young age. As they age, they take on more dangerous game with their sires, passing their skills down to the next generation. Finding work in civilized areas where their cannibalistic nature is not frowned upon is difficult, so drosera who leave their native jungles gravitate toward assassination work that allows them to take the lives (or limbs) of others.

entries.name: Drosera Names
entries: The drosera don't use traditional names between themself. The name is not something you have forever. Rather it is more like a Title which changes by feats or tasks. The individual is not as important as the part he takes in drosera society. Drosera who deal with other races often adopt names of the people they deal with, plants, or simple concepts.

entries.name: Male Names
entries: Glaemir, Bryn, Columbine, Del, Eldon, Erky, Mandrake, Solar, Vega, Red, Blue, Azule, Mandarin, Oak, Birch, Bark

entries.name: Female Names
entries: Breena, Carlin, Drusilia, Enna, Keyleth, Rose, Venus, Lux, Flora, Red, Blue, Azule, Ivy, Rosemary, Lily, Thorn, Umbra

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Alseid reach maturity by the age of 20. They can live well beyond 100 years, but it is unknown just how old they can become.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Alseid are generally chaotic neutral, though variations are common, particularly among those rare few who leave their people.

entries.name: Size
entries: Alseid stand over 6 feet tall and weigh around 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Alseid are fast for their size, with a base speed of 40 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Alseid Weapon Training.
entries: You are proficient with shortbows and spears.

entries.name: Light Hooves
entries: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Quadruped
entries: The mundane details of the structures of humanoids can present considerable obstacles for you, such as ladders and manholes.

entries.name: Woodfriend
entries: When in a forest, you leave no tracks and can automatically discern true north.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and fey.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Alseid are graceful woodland cousins to centaurs, blending the torsos of elves with the lower bodies of nimble deer. Because they rarely venture far from their wooded glades, some call them “grove nymphs,” although they’re more closely related to elves than nymphs.
Alseid see the forest as an individual and a friend. They are suspicious of outsiders who do not share this view.

Lost travelers who demonstrate deep respect for the forest may spot a distant alseid’s white tail and chase after it as it bounces toward a road that leads out of the forest. Disrespectful strangers may follow the same tail to their doom.

entries.name: Branching Crowns
entries: Alseid have antlers growing from their foreheads. Antlers grow very slowly, branching every 10 years for the first century of life (so an alseid with six points per antler should be between 60 and 70 years old). Further points only develop with the blessing of the forest. No 14-point imperial alseid are known to exist, but many tribes are governed by princes with 13 points, indicating that they’ve done a great service to the forest on at least three occasions. Because antlers signify status, alseid don’t fight with them the way deer do. Cutting an alseid’s antlers is one of the direst punishments an alseid can receive. Elf rangers sometimes report seeing lone alseid exiles, wandering the forest, their antlers sawn off near the scalp.

entries.name: Ancient Magic and Nature's Champions
entries: Alseid have a deep connection with the old fey magic of the forest. Their leaders favor the druid and ranger classes, and wild magic sorcerers arise from deep forest glades infused with energy from the fey realms.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Draugr don't realy age, they stay at the age where their transformation took place

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Draugr are generally neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Draugr are human sized. You are Medium size.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a movement speed of 30ft.

entries.name: Dimvision.
entries: You can see in dim light within 30 feet of you as if it were bright light, and darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Draugr Resilience.
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance to poison and necrotic damage.

entries.name: Memento Mori
entries: You are proficient in the History skill.

entries.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If you are reduced to 0 hit Points, you can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. If the damage was necrotic, you succeed your saving throw automatically. You can use this ability twice, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and undead.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one language of your choice.

Draugr are not a race, nor are they fully undead, although they are often mistaken for such creatures. “Draugr” is a common nomenclature for people of any race who share a semi-necrotic condition that increases their lifespans seemingly indefinitely. This condition appears when too much necrotic energy enters a humanoids body. A person inflicted has gray skin and hair and shows first signes of decay. Some manage to hold on to their Horns or other protusions while others lose them.

entries.name: Servants of the Dead Queen
entries: The first occurence of Draugr are widely acceptet to be the Draugr that resultet from the calamity that turned the land of Rehal into the Dead Zone. Many of the people who live in that land were transformed and are still serving their undead queen.

entries.name: Draugr Names
entries: Many Draugr keep their original name, but some see their transformation as a new life and thus choose a new name for themself.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Nychterids reach physical maturity at the age of 15, and can live up to 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Nychterids are usually of neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nychterids are between 3 and 4 feet tall, and weigh an average of 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: You have a base walking speed of 20 feet.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Your leathery wings grant you a flying speed of 30 feet. If you can attain a firm grasp, you can suspend your body from your feet without the need to make an ability check. You can’t fly or suspend yourself if you are wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries: As an action, you emit a short burst of high-pitched noise, audible up to 60 feet away, but perceptible only to bats, other nychterids, creatures with a keen hearing trait, or creatures with a passive Perception of 17 or higher. Until the end of your next turn, you have a blindsense to a distance of 30 feet.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries: You have advantage on checks you make with the Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) skills that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Nychterid Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against disease.

entries.name: Speak with Bats
entries: You can communicate with bats as if you shared a language.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Gourmand
entries: You are proficient with cook’s utensils.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Nychterid. Nychterid is a chittering language, involving many sounds at higher frequencies than most folk can hear.

entries.name: Nocturnal Sharers
entries: Nychterids are a race of sapient batfolk. They make their colonies in caves or large hollowed-out trees, preferring to live in forests or jungles. Most nychterid colonies have two locations, and like bats, make an annual migration between the two to stay with favorable weather and the availability of their preferred foods.

Nychterids are famously private as individuals, except within others of their colony. Most nychterids live in a commune of 2-6 other nychterids. No matter what a nychterid’s other vocation in life, within their communes, they share everything: living quarters, domestic labor, food, sexual partners and child-rearing responsibilities. Nychterids derive their surnames from their commune, which are chosen among its members, and can change when a new member is accepted into it. Nychterid children are given the surname of their birth commune until they join another.

This desire for relative insulation from others suits most nychterids just fine, as their resemblance to bats inspires a seemingly primal fear in folk, and they are often discriminated against, being thought to be harbingers of plague or disease, or the agents of vampires. This is, of course, ridiculous, and most nychterids maintain a diet of fruit and insects.

Everyone in nychterid society takes their turn in the kitchen, so most nychterids are gourmands. If a one has invited you to their home and prepared for you a meal, you know you have made a friend for life.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Strength score increases by 2, your intelligence score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Kabuto live protected lives inside their strong shells, and live long as a result. They reach full size in 6 years, and they live just past their second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The Kabuto prefer highly structured lives, tending to be lawful neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: The largest Kabuto stand at about 5 and one half feet tall, and average around 350 pounds. However some only reach 4 feet in height, and are much smaller in stature. Regardless, your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Concise Study
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks when attempting to find information through reading text.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your exoskeleton however grants you an AC of 17. Even though you can't wear armor, you still can use shields.

entries.name: Sylvan Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell thunderclap} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell shield} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level you can cast the {@spell shatter} spell as a 2md level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and fey.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.

Never in all my years had I seen such a beautiful sight as Kioko's Vault. Knowledge beyond our wildest dreams stored away forever, protected by our bravest Kabuto. I knew I had to persue a lifelong career here, especially after the librarians told me I had to in order to read the books.

A brute race of beetle-folk, the Kabuto use their physical strength to protect their highest value, knowledge. Other Humanoids dare not step into Kabuto territory, for its well known that their punishment is the harshest in all of Hokin.

entries.name: Powerful and Proud
entries: Kabuto are sturdily built with a chitinous beetle shell around their whole body. They stand hunched over, usually averaging at around 5 feet tall. But their makeup is dense, and often weigh around 350 pounds. They have long curled appendages, and often sport various styles of horns, but their lack of flexibility makes it unrealistic to use them in combat. Their eyes mirror light slightly with a blue, green, or yellow tints. Their shells are most often anywhere from brown and grey to blue and green. Some very rarely have vibrant patterns of many different colors.

entries.name: Practiced Intelligence
entries: Kabuto are addicted to collecting knowledge. Many Kabuto societies are built around grandious libraries. These societies rarely let others in as most other races cannot be trusted to treat their property with the same respect as they do.

The children are taught from a very young age to respect law and tradition, Kabuto do their best to regulate the world around them to follow their personal codes, but they often must accept the chaos of the outside world and adapt to it, despite their hatred for change. Their fervant respect of order, however, rarely blinds their logical judgement, and opinions are respected if put forth in a dignified and educated way.

entries.name: Kabuto Names
entries: The Kabuto's rigid structure is reflected in their process for naming their young. They reuse historically significant names to inspire traditional values in the children. The names are often of old Kabuto officials, heroes, or folklore. They do not have traditional families so they only have singular names.

entries.name: Names
entries: Aoi, Chihiro, Fuyuko, Hibiki, Jun, Kaede, Kyou, Masami, Noriko, Rin, Shiori, Tenzin, Tomomi, Yasu, Yoshi

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young witchknives grow slowly. They reach full size after 30 years but are not considered adults until the age of 50. On average, they live about 250 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most witchknives lean towards neutrality. While some fall on either side of true neutrality, most focus on protecting and maintaining their families over the worries of the larger world. Other races often misinterpret the witchknife's abilities and assume ill intent where it may not exist.

entries.name: Size
entries: Witchknives stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average 120 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Recognize Language
entries: You have advantage on inteligence checks to recognize writen or spoken languages, that you can't speak or read.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Psionic Command
entries: You know the {@spell message} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell command} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, and two extra languages of your choice. Witchknives are driven to learn a variety of languages, for their psionic commands are only obeyed by creatures that can understand them.

"By the Gods!" the cloaked human muttered under his breath as he was compelled to plunge into the cold, stagnant waters of the cistern. The rest of the tavern goers, who came out to watch, cackled with glee as the loudmouthed man burst back out of the brown waters, gasping for foul smelling air. The small humanoid he had confronted, stubby red horns atop his head and forming a rough goatee on his chin, grinned proudly before slipping into the crowd and disappearing.

Legend tells of a time when when all creatures spoke one language and athames ruled the world. Their word was law, and other creatures obeyed any command the athames gave. Then a deity interfered and taught the athames' subjects to speak new languages. This broke the athames' power over them and the subjects, who feared and hated the athames despite their magnanimous rule, rebelled and tore the athame empire to pieces.

entries.name: Thick Bodied
entries: Witchknives have tough skin that ranges in color from dark gray and brown to ruddy orange. They have short, red horns in places where other creatures have hair and their eyes are orange or yellow with red pupils. Their blocky frames rarely exceed 5 feet in height and average 120 pounds.

entries.name: Enclaves
entries: Witchknives live in small enclaves, with rarely more than two hundred adults, hidden away from the civilizations of other races. These enclaves have a hierarchy of rank determined by birth, but most witchknives are of equal rank and have many rights and privileges. Most witchknives live in a monastic manner inside fortresslike homes, spending their days meditating, training for combat, and learning.

entries.name: Natural Psionicists
entries: Witchknife is the name other creatures use to refer to the athames because of their power to compel victims to do their bidding with but a single utterance. A witchknife's psionic ability to command others relies on the target creature being able to understand the witchknife, which leads witchknives to seek out and learn as many languages as possible. This is the driving force for any witchknife who leaves the confines of their enclave.

entries.name: Witchknife Names
entries: Witchknives are given nicknames upon their birth, generally describing the color tone their skin takes. Once a witchknife reaches adulthood, they select a new name for themselves, generally combining it with their nickname. There is little distinction between male and female names and witchknives never assume a surname; choosing instead to use the name of their enclave.

entries.name: Nicknames
entries: Amber, Ash, Black, Bone, Coal, Ember, Flint, Grey, Iron, Onyx, Rose, Steel

entries.name: Adult Names
entries: Amberaxe, Ashblade, Blackrock, Bonechin, Coalheart, Emberfist, Flintcutter, Greyfox, Ironback

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ikiwi reach maturity at 10 years, and live up to 60 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Ikiwi tend toward neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Ikiwi average 2-3 feet tall, and weigh around 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet. If both of your hands are unoccupied, you can run on all fours at a speed of 35 feet.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made that rely on sight.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Leverage
entries: You can wield weapons with the heavy property without the penalty usually applied to small creatures.

entries.name: Owlbear Talons
entries: You have sharp talons, which grant you a climbing speed of 20 feet. In addition, your claws and beak are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Patterned Feathers
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when you attempt to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and monstrosity.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write, Common and iki.

entries.name: Instinct, Evolved
entries: Ikiwi resemble bipedal owls with no wings and short, talon-fingered hands. Some suspect they are descendants of the first owlbears, or part of the same set of experiments that created them. They are short, stocky and share the enhanced musculature of their larger cousins.

Ikiwi prefer to live in mountains and boreal forests, and are capable hunters. A few even live in the most barren of deserts. Rarely farmers, ikiwi consider it a point of pride to hunt their own dinner.

Ikiwi mate for life as a general rule, and their families rarely exceed four individuals at a time. If a family grows too large, the eldest child is encouraged to leave the nest and start their own family. Leaving the nest marks adulthood in their lives, and their parents make a great display, showering gifts and well-wishes upon their departing child, or throwing a party attended by friends and even extended family.
Although ikiwi are typically shy, cautious, and generally slow to trust others, they make steadfast friends and trustworthy allies.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Quagsir are hatched as an armless, larval form called a Woopy. They mature within 2 years, growing arms and achieving their adult Quagsir form. Once matured, a Quagsir can live as long as 25 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Quagsir generally keep to themselves, preferring neutral alignments. Their oblivious, self-serving nature quashes any interest they may have in the struggle between law and chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Quagsir usually stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and weigh between 150 and 200 lbs. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 25 feet, and you have a swimming speed of 25 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious.
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Iron Tail.
entries: Your thick, club-like tail acts as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Damp.
entries: Your thick skin and swampy habitat have made your body a natural shock absorber. You are resistant to lightning damage.

entries.name: Ice Beam.
entries: You know the Ray of Frost cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and elemental.

entries.name: Hybrid Natures
entries: You can become the target of any ability, spell or effect that affects either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Aquan.
These froglike creatures make their home in the elemental plane of water, they live in small communes and do simple jobs. They don't care much for the larger politics.

entries.name: Biology
entries: Quagsir are light blue, bipedal, amphibious Humanoids. Their heads are broad and round, having little neck to distinguish it from the rest of their bodys. They have a wide mouth and tiny, black eyes. A wavy, purple stripe runs down their back. Along their spine is a dark blue fin, which is larger on the males than on the females. Quagsir's hands and feet both have three digits. Their outer layer of skin is slimy and slippery.

entries.name: Unaware Waterdwellers
entries: Quagsir are carefree and sluggish by nature. These lazy creatures tend to bump their heads inadvertently while swimming on their back and seem not to care or be hurt in any way. They sometimes just lay still in the water, leaving their mouths open and waiting for fresh fish to enter.

entries.name: Quagsir Names
entries: Quagsir don't realy care for names. They change what they are called related to who they are talking to. Most adventuring Quagsir choose a nickname others gave them as theirs.

language.name: Nychterid
entries: Nychterid is a chittering language, involving many sounds at higher frequencies than most folk can hear.

language.name: Iki
entries: Iki is a language of clicks, caws, and whistles and does not have its own written language. Most ikiwi write in Common or in pictographs.

table.caption: Major Injury
rows: You have disadvantage on attack rolls for {@dice 1d4*10} days and loose any proficiency you have with perseption.
Disadvantage on Attack rolls and you fall unconcious in 3 turns
You'r strength score is reduced by 2 points for the next {@dice 1d6} days
Movement is halved and you fall unconcious in 3 turns
Your movement reduces by 10 feet for the next {@dice 1d6} days
You must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each turn. If failed, movement is halved and attack rolls have disadvantage for that turn. You fall unconcious in 3 turns

You must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each turn. If failed, movement is halved and attack rolls have disadvantage for that turn. If you fail this save 3 times you fall unconcious

You must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each turn. If failed, movement is halved OR attack rolls have disadvantage for that turn (DMs discretion). If you fail this save 3 times you fall unconcious
You gain 1 Hit Dice + Con temporary hit points, your strength doubles, your dexterity is halved and you can dash and disengage as a bonus action. These effects were off after {@dice 1d4} rounds.
table.name: Major Injury Table

deity.name: Asmodeus
deity.title: the Lord of the Nine Hells
deity.symbol: Three inverted triangles arranged in a long triangle
entries: The devil god of the Hells is the master of tyranny and domination. His words are honeyed and carefully crafted, soothing and corrupting the mortal heart. Asmodeus rules his domain with an iron fist, and the punishments awaiting those that cross him are the basis of nightmares. Evil entities pay him tribute alongside his devils, and many warlocks are drawn to his power.
Asmodeus lords over his fiendish hordes from within his fortress of Nalsheem, nestled in the depths of Nessus, the ninth and deepest of the Nine Hells.

items: Assert dominance and power over others. Show your strength of will in the image of the Asmodeus.
Repay cruelty done unto you with further evil. If others show you kindness, exploit it.
As you ascend to power, do not pity or show mercy to those you climb over to get there. Compassion is for the weak.

deity.name: Avandra
deity.title: the Change Bringer
entries: Also known as "She Who Makes the Path," Avandra champions freedom, travel, trade, and adventure across the lands. Her will heralds open frontiers, and her call beckons her followers to discover that which awaits them beyond the known. There are few urban temples dedicated to the Change Bringer, but her shrines are often found along well-traveled roads and off the beaten path. Her worship is common among merchants, free spirits, and adventurers, and tavern cheers celebrate her as a bringer of luck and fortune.
Avandra calls no domain in the planes her residence, instead eternally wandering through the Outer Planes where serenity can be found, distantly watching over the potential of mortals.

items: Luck favors the bold. Your fate is your own to grasp, and to do so is to have the Change Bringer behind you.
Change is inevitable. The righteous can ensure that such change is for the better.
Rise against tyranny. Fight for the freedom of yourself and others when you can, and inspire others to fight when you cannot.

deity.name: Bahamut
deity.title: the Platinum Dragon
entries: The pillar of justice, protection, nobility, and honor, Bahamut is a beacon to paladins of order and good, and is revered by most metallic dragons as the first of their kind. The crest of the Platinum Dragon adorns many halls of high leadership and justice, invoking his will in all matters of justice. To follow him is to look after those who cannot look after themselves.
When not wandering the Outer Planes, Bahamut resides within his magnificent, glittering palace of gold, platinum, and mithril hidden among the winds of the Seven Heavens of Celestia.

items: Stand as a paragon of honor and justice.
Smite evil wherever it is found, yet show compassion to those who have strayed from the path of righteousness.
Defend the weak, bring freedom to the persecuted, and protect the ideals of justice and order.

deity.name: Bane
deity.title: the Strife Emperor
deity.symbol: Upright black hand, thumb and fingers together
entries: Blood-drenched armies of brutal warriors oft crush their foes in the name of Bane, the evil patron of war and conquest. To serve his will is to accept the call to conflict, seeking lesser people to break and subjugate. Warmongering nations and goblinoid tribes worship the Strife Emperor as they strike out at the world to bend it beneath them. Bane twists all living things to his iron will, forcing even nature itself to bow to his whims.
Bane plots his conquest of the planes from within the bastion of Banehold, towering among the blood-soaked battlefields of Acheron.

items: Fear is your ally. Conquer your fear and inspire it in your foes.
Disorder and rebellion are to be punished severely.
Combat is the greatest gift, and perfecting your skills to master it is the greatest pursuit.

deity.name: Corellon Larethian
deity.title: the Arch Heart
entries: Guardian of spring, beauty, and the arts, Corellon is the patron of arcane magic and the fey. The Founding inspired them to wander the twisted lands, seeding them with the first arcane magics and raising the most ancient of forests. It was by the Arch Heart's hand that the first elves wandered from the Feywild, and for this reason they are considered the Mother and Father of all elves. Those who seek art in all their work, whether magical or mundane, often worship at the altar of Corellon. They loathe the Spider Queen and her priestesses for leading the drow astray.
Corellon watches the business of mortals and gods from within the palace of Crescent Grove in the beautiful realm of Arborea, surrounded by towering white trees and pillars of marble.

items: Create, inspire, and find beauty in all that you do.
Follow the echoes of lost magics, forgotten sites, and ancient art, for within these lie the Arch Heart's first works.
Combat the followers of Lolth wherever they might be.

deity.name: Gruumsh
deity.title: He Who Watches
entries: Gruumsh commands hordes of barbaric marauders to destroy, pillage, and slaughter for the sheer joy of it. Orderless and without honor, the creeds of the evil hordemaster urge savage creatures to devour the world around them, giving in to the chaotic and selfish nature of the predator. A number of violent clans of humanoids and beasts pay homage to Gruumsh, asking him to bless their hunts and gift them with spoils worth ruining.
Gruumsh rules the barren plains of Nishrek in the chaotic realm of Acheron, where he stokes the fury of his twisted armies and prepares to wage a violent war across the planes.

items: Ruin. Conquer. Kill.
The weak exist to be crushed by the strong. Be the strong.
There are no emotions but fury and joy. The rest are weakness.

deity.name: Erathis
deity.title: the Law Bearer
deity.symbol: Upper half of a clockwork gear
entries: The inspiration behind many great inventions, the creation of vast cities, and law and order within society, Erathis claims dominion over civilization. Judges and rulers pay respect at her temples, which are central structures in many cities across Exandria. Peace and order through structure and law guides the will of her devout followers. The Law Bearer has a tempestuous romance with Melora the Wild Mother, a furious love that is tempered only when civilization and nature are in balance.

Erathis resides within the glorious divine metropolis of Hestavar, the Bright City. This glowing oasis coasts through the Astral Plane, as the Law Bearer watches over the denizens bathed in the endless daytime that illuminates the busy streets.

items: Utilize the company and aid of others. The efforts of the individual often pale against the capabilities of the community.
Strive to tame the wilds in the name of civilization, and defend the points of light and order against the chaos of darkness.
Uphold and revere the spirit of invention. Create new settlements, build where inspiration strikes, and expand the edicts of the Law Bearer.

deity.name: Kord
deity.title: the Storm Lord
deity.symbol: Sword with a lightning bolt cross guard
entries: Where thunder booms and conflict rises, prayers to the Storm Lord are shouted into the maelstrom. Reveling in all tests of strength, Kord blesses those who prove themselves on the battlefield. Worshiped by athletes and warriors all across the World, he exalts those whose force of spirit and desire for victory call his attention. He brings tumultuous storms over land and sea, and those who wish for clearer skies offer their praises and prayers to appease him.
Kord dwells among the roving settlements and battlefields within the rugged and glorious realm of Ysgard, where struggle, victory, and celebration shape the landscape and those who reside there.

items: Bravery above all. There is no glory in cowardice.
Strength is the path to greatness, but greatness is the responsible use of strength.
The glory of the Storm Lord lives through your own glory on the battlefield.

deity.name: Lolth
deity.title: the Spider Queen
entries: The evil god of deceit, shadows, and spiders, Lolth weaves a complicated web of schemes and treachery through her worshipers, deceiving allies and enemies alike to gain power. It is said that the Spider Queen can see through the eyes of all spiders, and that she is truly all-knowing. Lolth's worship is entwined with the society of dark elves.
Lolth sends forth her corrupting poisons and whispers from her realm of the Demonweb, which is tethered to the Abyss and home to her many spider children.

items: It is better to be loved than feared, but you may certainly try to be both.
Misdirection, slander, and shadowed steps have more function than direct conflict.
Death to the elves who live under the sun, and death to all their allies!

deity.name: Melora
deity.title: the Wild Mother
entries: The realm of Melora extends to wherever the seas shift and the land grows wild. As the keeper of the wilderness, Melora represents the wild creatures of nature, the rush of the angry rapids, and the heat-heavy stillness of the desert. Elves worship her, as do hunters, accepting her guidance to exist harmoniously within savage lands. Those seeking safe passage across dangerous waters pray to her to guide them.

Followers of the Raven Queen also show respect to the Wild Mother as the caretaker of what remains when the Matron of Death's work is done. Druids of Melora the Wild Mother and clerics of her lover, Erathis the Law Bearer, work together to preserve the balance of nature and civilization.
Eschewing a permanent realm, Melora prefers to wander the planes to oversee natural life. She is often found among the unearthly beauty of deep woods, hunting unnatural things that corrupt the wilds.

items: Protect the untamed wilderness from exploitation and destruction.
Slay abominations and other mockeries of nature.
Embrace and respect the savage nature of the world. Exist in harmony with it.

deity.name: Pelor
deity.title: the Dawn Father
deity.symbol: Circle with six outwardly radiating points
entries: Pelor rules over the sun, his vigil encircling the ages as the keeper of time. As lord of agriculture and harbinger of the harvest, he is worshiped by farmers and most common folk, and his priests are welcomed in many lands. Supporter of the needy and destroyer of evil, the Dawn Father is often the patron of paladins and rangers who follow a similar creed. He is also known for his defeat of the Chained Oblivion and is revered by those who hunt aberrations.
Pelor is often found within the Fortress of the Sun, a shining, golden citadel that brings vibrant life to the limitless orchards of the Blessed Fields of Elysium.

items: Be ever vigilant for evil. People are quick to forget the lessons of the past.
Help relieve the suffering of the innocent.
Deliver the light of Pelor where darkness dwells, with kindness, compassion, and mercy.

deity.name: Sehanine Moonbow
deity.title: the Moon Weaver
entries: Sehanine is the god of moonlight and the autumn season, as well as the patron of illusions and misdirection. Widely worshiped in halfling and elven cultures, she is considered to be the deity of love, protecting the trysts of lovers with shadows of her own making. Those who work in darkness and trickery often ask for her blessing.
Sehanine is found among the verdant tangles of the realm of Arborea, watching over the elven courts, or wandering among the colorful fields of the Feywild.

items: Seize your own destiny by pursuing your passions.
Let the shadows protect you from the burning light of fanatical good and the absolute darkness of evil.
Walk unbridled and untethered, forging new memories and experiences.

deity.name: Tharizdun
deity.title: the Chained Oblivion
entries: It is darkness unending, less like a god and more like another world. Life and death do not exist within Tharizdun, only utter destruction and madness. In its endless imprisonment, Tharizdun dreams the infinite depths of the Abyss into reality, along with all its demonic legions. The Prime Deities have it locked away, hoping that it will never return.

Now, its chaotic mind has fallen into more frightful dreams, imagining nightmarish aberrations into existence deep beneath the Abyss. The Chained Oblivion's demented cultists work without word from their twisted patron, awaiting the Epoch of Ends, when its freedom will be attained and all beings shall be consumed in deathlessness unending.
Tharizdun is believed to be chained in the deepest pits of the Abyss, bound by divine shackles that slowly weaken, leaking its madness into the planes.

items: Offer and siphon power to Tharizdun until his liberation comes.
Uncover, restore, and exalt forgotten shrines and relics in his honor.
Ruin and raze the realms to prepare for the Epoch of Ends.

deity.name: The Raven Queen
deity.title: Matron of Death
deity.symbol: Silhouette of a front facing raven with ist wings spread out.
entries: Master of the skein of fate, the Raven Queen is the god of death. Her gaze follows and marks the end of each mortal life, watching over the border between life and death and ensuring the natural transition is undefiled. Many funerals ask her blessing to protect the deceased from the terrible curse of undeath. Those who study ancient lore believe that the Matron of Death was once mortal herself. Her rise instantly obliterated the previous, now-forgotten god of death.
The Raven Queen tugs at the threads of fate from her stronghold of black steel within the barren realm of Arkris, nestled in a frigid corner of the Shadowfell.

items: Death is the natural end of life. There is no pity for those who have fallen.
The path of Fate is sacrosanct. Those who pridefully attempt to cast off their destiny must be punished.
Undeath is an atrocity. Those who would pervert the transition of the soul must be brought down.

deity.name: Tiamat
deity.title: the Scaled Tyrant
entries: The evil queen of dragons is a fearsome god of greed, envy, and hoarded wealth. While chromatic dragons are her foremost worshipers, Tiamat accepts the worship of any who crave wealth. All chromatic dragons have a fearful reverence for their tyrannical queen, but many dragons of near-deific power and ambition chafe under her rule.
Tiamat remains imprisoned in Avernus, the first of the Nine Hells, influencing the souls of chromatic dragons across the planes and seeking the means to free herself.

items: Amass wealth, but spend little. The gold\u2014and the power that comes with it\u2014is sufficient reward in itself.
Do not forgive nor forget an indignity to yourself. Let no affront go unpunished.
Take what you covet. Those without the strength to defend their dominion are not worthy to have one.

deity.name: Torog
deity.title: the Crawling King
deity.symbol: T attached to a circular shackle
entries: The dark god of the endless tunnels and caverns beneath the World, Torog is the patron of torturers, slavers, and jailers across the realms. His violent tears carved the pathways under the world, and his realm of imprisonment is a network of deadly caves and manacles from which few return. Those who rob others of their freedom offer prayers to him in cellars and other subterranean domains, and many creatures who live in the darkness below worship him and seek his guidance.

Torog remains banished within an unknown sliver of the Far Realm that now borders the deepest pits of the Underdark, where the boundaries between worlds grow thin and birth terrible abominations bent on subjugation.

items: Seek and exalt places where no light touches.
Revel in the pain you inflict on others, and relish the pain you suffer yourself as an offering to Torog.
Imprison those who cannot resist you, and drag all life into the darkness.

deity.name: Zehir
deity.title: the Cloaked Serpent
deity.symbol: Snake in the shape of a dagger
entries: A wanderer in the shadows and the creator of snakes and serpentkin, Zehir is the evil god of poisons, assassins, and darkness. The ancient serpentkin worship him over all other deities, dragging screaming offerings to their temples in his honor. The Serpent-Folk and their Kingdoms fell in wars and only a few remain alive today. But perhaps Zehir is merely biding his time, waiting for the proper moment to unleash his hidden armies on the world once more.
Zehir subverts and poisons the World from the shadowed Towers of Night, hidden among the ever-shifting winds of the Astral Plane.

items: Keep your acts obfuscated and secret. The night is your greatest ally.
Strike quickly and without reason. Blind the target with their own confusion.
Kill slowly. Agonizingly. Or worse, make them enjoy it.

deity.name: Moradin
deity.title: the All-Hammer
entries: Moradin is worshiped by smiths, artisans, and miners alike, granting inspiration in exchange for respect and prayer. He shaped the mountains from the chaos of the Founding, and stands as the patron protector of home and family. The devotion to the All-Hammer is strongest in dwarven communities, and many temples to Moradin mark the center of a mighty dwarven stronghold.
Moradin lords over the soul forges within the massive tunneled mansion of Erackinor, deep beneath the slopes of Solania on the plane of Celestia.

items: Remain stoic and tenacious in the face of catastrophe.
Uphold and promote loyalty to your family, loyalty to your clan, and loyalty to your people.
Legacy is paramount. To create something that lasts is to change the world for the better.

deity.name: Rala
deity.title: the Arcane Mistress
deity.symbol: five pointed star on a shield
entries: The old God of Magic diapeared one day, getting almost instantley replaced by Rala. The Arcane Mistress took control of the Weave. She is the yougest of the Prime Deitys and is Worshiped by Wizards and Scribes
Rala resides in her Magical library of Sigil.

items: Love magic for itself. Do not treat it just as a weapon to reshape the world to your will. True wisdom is knowing when not to use magic.

Magic is Art, the Gift of the Lady, and those who wield it are privileged in the extreme. Conduct yourself humbly, not proudly, while being mindful of this. Use the Art deftly and efficiently, not carelessly and recklessly.
Seek always to learn and create new magic.

deity.name: Belesat
deity.title: the Mindfull Crystal
entries: Shaped through raw Psionic potential Belesat was created. The Mindfull Crystal holds the powers that bring clear thought and control of Mind to its followers.

items: Your Mind is your Highest Posession. Treat it with care and you will achieve greatness.
Clear thought will lead to a great life. Don't distract yourself with physical wealth.

deity.name: Orle
deity.title: the Overgrowth
entries: The Overgrowth is seen by many not as a god, but as a pure force of nature. The force that lets plants grow and take back civilization. Few humanoids worship Orle. The Majority of her Followers are Plantfolk.
Orle Resides in Orechid, the most Overgrown part of the Shadowfell

items: Plants are the Rightfull Rulers of the Planes. Accept this fact and your place.
The green should spread anywhere. Leave Saplings and Seeds wherever you go and nurture them wherever you find them.

deity.name: Ain
deity.title: the Unity
entries: Ain is worshiped in Haval. In the cold regions of Haval, the struggle for survival is everlasting, and Ain helps his worshipers with happiness and fellowship.

items: Community is our biggest Strength. Accept your place in it and be a part of a great whole.
Happieness is something only achievable together. Give some to others so that the godness you give may someday return to you.

deity.name: Khor
deity.title: the Unbroken
entries: Kohr is the son of the god Ain and is worshiped in Haval. In the cold regions of Haval, the struggle for survival is everlasting, and Kohr helps his worshipers with strength and willpower.

items: To Survive you shell strengthen your mind and body. The weak will only perish.
If you survive a foe stronger than you, strive to surpass them.

deity.name: Toka
deity.title: wits of the weak
entries: Toka is the daughter of the god Ain and is worshiped in Haval. In the cold regions of Haval, the struggle for survival is everlasting, and Toka helps their worshipers with wit and magic.

items: Brain over Brawn. Don't fight if you don't have a plan on how to win
Don't trust things you don't know. The only thing you can fully trust is yourself.

deity.name: Arzui
deity.title: the wandering
deity.symbol: four pointed star within a circle
entries: Arzui was originally one of the two Halfling deities. Her followers were wanderes who traveled the world to see it. Now she is now worshiped by various races in Leal. She protects wanderers and many pray to her for safe arrival.

items: Behold as much of the world as you can. Her beauty shall inspire you to travel even farther.
Keep the valuable moments of your travels deep within you, for memories are the only true treasure.

deity.name: Oripe
deity.title: the undying beauty
entries: Oripe was originally one of the two Halfling deities. Today her influence is reduced to small groups. She appreciates kinship between her followers and many pray to her to maybe be imparted with an aspect of her beauty

items: Beauty is true Treasure. Always try to be the most beautifull you can be.
Beauty is worthless without someone to behold it, so share your beauty with others.

deity.name: Null
deity.title: the Deathwyrm
deity.symbol: the skull of a black dragon
entries: In the beginning when the first dragon died and split up into Bahamut and Tiamat, the empty hull of it's body fell down into the negative energy plane. There the hull was reawakened into the Deathwyrm Null.

Null is the dragon god of death and undeath, living in the negative energy plane. He ferries the souls of dead dragons to their final resting place and ensured they are no longer troubled by the enemies they may have had in life.

items: All life eventually leads into death, which is simply a starting point to another kind of existence.
Embracing death makes you stronger, as it is a natural part of life.

deity.name: The Pharao
deity.title: infinite life
entries: The immortal Pharaoh of Ajawo' is worshiped as a god. There are many rumors how this mortal beeing achieved godhood. Some even believe his godhood is just a rumor spread by himself while others say that the gods themselves have elevated him into their ranks.

items: Serve the Pharao, for he is the only King there should be.
Life is a curse bestowed upon mortals, made to be broken. Strive to achieve immortality in any way possible.

deity.name: The Gray Dragon
deity.symbol: the profile of a whole blue dragon
entries: The monstous races started to worship the entity not to long ago. It is unknown where it came from or how it came to be.

deity.name: The Entertainer
entries: This powerful aberration of anarchic intent, who travels the planes searching for his next victim to torment, seems to even be able to evade the power of other gods. Not much is known about the Entertainer except, that he strives to create stories that are worthy to be told.
You want to know why you have to suffer? Well isn't that clear?
It's because of them. They want to be entertained.
A story without conflict is hardly entertaining. They wouldn't like that.
So do me a favour and don't ask why. Just play your part.

deity.name: Auril
deity.title: Empress of Winter
entries: Auril, the merciless goddess of cold and winter, is worshiped mostly in regions that are affected by deep winters. Folk propitiate Auril with offerings and prayers for mercy. Her priests warn others to prepare for winter, and to stock extra provisions in order to have some to spare as offerings to the goddess.

Few favor Auril except for those who make their livelihood from winter or those who truly love the season. Her rare priests tend to be folk who would, but for their status, likely be outcasts from their communities. They practice celibacy and remain aloof from others when not serving in their official capacity.
She has her palace in the coldest regions of the feywild, where the snow never melts.

items: Cover all the lands with  ice. Quench fire wherever it is found.
Let in the winds and the cold; cut downwind breaks and chop holes in walls and roofs that my breath may come in. Work darknesses to hide the cursed sun so that the chill I bring may slay.
Take the life of an arctic creature only in great need, but slay all others at will. Make the world fear me.

deity.name: Shar
deity.symbol: Black disk encircled with a blue border
deity.title: Queen of the Night
entries: Shar is the goddess of darkness, both in its physical form and as it exists in the minds and souls of mortals. People worship Shar as the goddess of night, secrets, loss, and forgetfulness. She represents pains hidden but not forgotten, and vengeances carefully nurtured away from the light. She is said to have the power to make folk forget their pain or become inured to a loss, and many people in distress pray to Shar for such a blessing.

Shar is revered by those who must venture into dark places and so pray to her for protection, such as miners, as well as by those who have fallen into melancholy and despair, who wish to forget something, or who have lost something and wish to recover it. Priests drawn to serve Shar often nurture their own deep wounds or dark secrets, which in their minds makes them best suited to console those who suffer from a similar ill. Throughout the world's history, many followers of Shar have done dark deeds in her name. The tragedies and losses brought about by the fanaticism of her followers have caused many places to outlaw her worship and thus driven most of her priests into secrecy, but such prohibitions only heighten the priests' umbrage at authorities and make the faithful a focal point for rebellion and revenge against whoever rules.

The Queen of the Night is said to wander freely between the feywild and the shadowfell. Some even believe her to be able to enter the Negative plane. But her home is the Castle of neverday, in the feywild.

items: Learn all you can, and keep hidden that which you know. Reveal secrets only to fellow members of the Faithful.
Never turn to hope, or follow promises of success.
The dark is a time to act, not wait.

deity.name: The Hag Mother
deity.symbol: a silver ring floating over a blue challice
entries: Rumored to be the oldest hag and progenitor of all other hags, the Hag Mother arrived in the world just after the Founding. She has a soft spot for humanoids in peril that caused her original coven to exile and bind her to this world with a magical curse. She wanders the land, making deals with people in dire straits, offering the power to save themselves in return for their service. The tasks the Hag Mother asks of those who accept her deals are always dangerous and sometimes grotesque and cruel. Some of these quests save lives, while others end them. Others still result in the creation of more hags. Many of the missions seem to serve no purpose, but the Hag Mother always has a plan. Whether her endgame is to destroy her enemies, break her curse, or expand her rule is known only to the Hag Mother herself.
The other fey nobility fear her unknown power and as such acceptet her into her ranks, even though no fey kingdom is under her rule.

deity.name: Bhri
deity.title: Bhramari Queen
entries: The Bhramari Queen is known as the Mother of all insects. Some say you should not speak secrets in the feywild, unless absolutely sure no insect is nearby. She binds her followers into her swarm, taking part of their autonomy in exchange for parttaking in the Hivemind
The Kingdom of Bhri is deep in the underground of the feywild where she resides on her crystaline throne.

items: You are part of the Hive. Your thoughts are ours and our thoughts are yours.
The hive is more importatnt than any of it's parts. Give your live to save it.
Grow the hive with every opportunity. The larger the Hive, the stronger we are.

deity.name: Malar
deity.title: Lord of the Hunt
entries: Malar epitomizes the dark side of nature, the world that is red in tooth and claw. His faithful believe the hunt is the center point between life and death - the facing off of hunter and prey, forcing the issue of who lives and who dies. People believe that Malar can't be propitiated and knows no mercy, so he receives prayers only from those engaging in a hunt. Such supplicants pray to Malar for two reasons: to beg the aid of his peerless skill as a hunter, or to adopt his fearsome mantle and thus ward off other predators. Malar is the god of those who delight in the hunt, don't shy from bloodshed, and savor the fear of their prey.

Many lycanthropes consider Malar to be their divine father, as do some other intelligent predators. He has many devotees who are druids and rangers of particularly savage inclination, and many barbarians take Malar as a patron for his ferocity and cruelty. His priests use claw bracers, impressive gauntlets bedecked with stylized claws that jut out from the ends of the fists, as ceremonial weapons.
Even though his woods are not governed by him, the other fey do not dare to enter, for anything not athome hear is prey.

items: Prey is there to be prayed upon. Don't hesitate to strike.
There is no gain from denying the natural order of things. So kill or get killed.
Never to waste the game from a hunt. Eat what you kill.

deity.name: Deep Sashelas
deity.title: Water King
entries: Deep Sashelas, sometimes known just as Sashelas, is the elven deity of the sea, and seafaring. He is especially beloved by sea elves, dolphins, and elf sages.

Most of Sashelas's most devoted followers are sea elves, as are his priests. Many seafarers toss offerings of gold and jewels overboard, beseeching Sashelas to calm storms or provide favorable winds, and he is inclined to aid them even if they aren't fully dedicated to his worship. His sea elf priests often lurk in the water beneath ships when these offerings are made. They catch the treasures as they sink and use them to decorate Sashelas's underwater shrines, to purchase items from coastal merchants that can't be manufactured underwater, and to bribe dragon turtles into their service. Ceremonies honoring Sashelas are held underwater at times of uncommonly high tides or during electrical storms, when flashes of lightning above the waves provide illumination to the calmer realm below the surface.
His Home is hidden somewhere within the seas of the feywild.

items: Swim the great currents and the shallow seas. Exult in the dynamic beauty and life of the bounteous Undersea.
Seek not to hold that which is everchanging, but instead love the change itself.
Seek out fellow swimmers who honor the ways of the Lord of the Undersea, and ally with them against those who see only the darkness of the deeps.

deity.name: Rillifane Rallathil
deity.title: Prince of the Summer
entries: When the other Fey Nobility decided on humanoid forms, Rillifane took a different approach. He took as his principal form that of an enormous oak tree, taller and wider than any other. Its roots are so deep and far-reaching that they touch the roots of every other plant in the world, or so it's said. Through this network of tendrils, Rillifane remains aware of everything that happens in the forest.

his main concerns are the welfare of forests and prairies, the passing of the seasons, and the lives of beasts. Most of his followers and priests are elf druids. They're just as insular and secretive as any other druids, which means their motives are often not clear to those around them.

items: Live in harmony with the natural world, allowing each living being the opportunity to serve out its natural purpose in life.
Defend the great forests from those who seek to ravage their riches, leaving only destruction in their path.
Hold strong like the great oaks in the face of those who can see only their own immediate needs.

deity.name: Istishia
deity.title: The Everflowing
entries: Istishia is one Espect of the Elemental Lady, they represent the change that naturally comes from moving water.
They are worshipped by bards, elemental archons of water, sailors and travelers.

items: Do not try to be what you are not; rather, excel at what you are and carry this message of personal excellence to the world.
Be flexible but not unreasonable.
The mysteries of life are to be enjoyed and puzzled over, but realize that some answers do not come in this world, but rather in the next.

deity.name: Kossuth
deity.title: The Devouring Hunger
entries: Kossuth is one Espect of the Elemental Lady, they represent the destruction that fire brings.
The church of Kossuth is rather hierarchical and mostly impersonal. The Church's aims tend to revolve around the acquisition of land, power and wealth.

items: Those fit to succeed will do so.
The reward of successful ambition is power. Reaching a higher state is inevitably accomplished by difficulty and personal pain of some sort.
Expect to be tested, and rise to the challenge, no matter what difficulty and pain it brings. Those above you have proven their worth and deserve your service.

deity.name: Grumbar
deity.title: The Unchanging
entries: Grumbar is one Espect of the Elemental Lady, they represent the prevailing of the earth.
The church of Grumbar is organized into small sects known as Holds, each comprising three groups of seven members, divided by their individual skillsets, each supported by a number of lay people.

items: Strive to be more like the eternal one, not to change or allow change to happen.
One’s given word is the bedrock upon which is stable society is built. To break an oath is to cause a crack in the foundation of civilization.

deity.name: Akadi
deity.title: The Wreathing Flow
entries: Akadi is one Espect of the Elemental Lady, they represent the all encompassing, live giving air.
Akadi does not care much how many followers they have. Their followers are not realy organizing in any way, prioritizing their individuality.

items: Find your own enlightenment in your interests.
Move from activity to activity, from place to place, pursuing a personal dream or series of interests and growing through the changing experiences each new day brings.
Do not ever let yourself be fettered or imprisoned, for constrained life is little better than death.
